title: Reusable hero header images for main tabs

requirements.summary: Create a reusable HeroHeader component with responsive, accessible hero image styling used across main tab views.
acceptanceCriteria: A reusable hero/header component exists and can be used by Task List, Dinner Rota, Calendar, and People views.
Hero section is responsive (maintains aspect ratio, crops via object-cover), has rounded corners, and uses an overlay to ensure any text remains readable.
All hero images have non-empty, descriptive alt text in English.

file_operations.description: Create a reusable HeroHeader component that renders a static hero image with consistent styling: responsive aspect ratio, object-cover cropping, rounded corners, and a gradient overlay layer to improve text readability; supports passing non-empty English alt text and optional title/subtitle content.

requirements.summary: Add distinct hero images to Task List, Dinner Rota, Calendar, and People tab views using the new HeroHeader styling.
acceptanceCriteria: Task List shows a hero image above the "Household Tasks" header content.
Dinner Rota shows a hero image in its header area (keeping or replacing the existing image block, but using the new consistent hero/header styling).
Calendar shows a hero image above the "Calendar View" header content.
People shows a hero image above the "People" header content.
No hero images are loaded via backend; all are served as static assets.

file_operations.description: Import and render the new HeroHeader component at the top of the Task List view, above the existing "Household Tasks" header area, using the static asset path /assets/generated/hero-task-list.dim_1600x400.jpg with a descriptive English alt text.

Replace (or refactor) the existing header image block to use the new HeroHeader component for consistent styling, referencing /assets/generated/hero-dinner-rota.dim_1600x400.jpg with a descriptive English alt text; ensure it appears in the header area above the main Dinner Rota content.

Import and render the new HeroHeader component at the top of the Calendar view, above the existing "Calendar View" header area, referencing /assets/generated/hero-calendar.dim_1600x400.jpg with a descriptive English alt text.

Import and render the new HeroHeader component at the top of the People view, above the existing "People" header area, referencing /assets/generated/hero-people.dim_1600x400.jpg with a descriptive English alt text.

requirements.summary: Add generated hero images as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference them via absolute paths.
acceptanceCriteria: All new hero image files exist under frontend/public/assets/generated.
Each tab references its corresponding hero image path and renders successfully in the browser without 404s.
